ygData.subject: RE: New bard questions
ygData.msgSnippet: Ooooh, ouch! Jerrilia, Don t let the talk here going on between the high level bards give you the wrong idea about the bard class.  We absolutely love playing
ygData.messageBody:
Ooooh, ouch!

Jerrilia,

Don't let the talk here going on between the high level bards give you the
wrong idea about the bard class. We absolutely love playing the bard class
and most of us would probably agree that it is the best choice we could have
made in terms of enjoying the game.

At the same time, these high level players have been playing for about 9
months (at least) longer than you and the game has gone through a lot of
changes during that time. We all tend to get on rants from time to time but
fact of the matter is, we do it because we love our bards.

Welcome to Norrath fellow songweaver.

Faras Tar'Linedhel
Half-Elf Bard of the 39th (and holding) song on E'ci



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jennifer McComb [mailto:mccomb@...]
> Sent: Friday, February 11, 2000 1:30 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] New bard questions
>
>
> From: Jennifer McComb <mccomb@...>
>
> Let me introduce myself. I'm a new player to Everquest
> (received it for
> Christmas). I've played an Erudite paladin up to level 7, a Barbarian
> shamon up to level 9, and now I'm a half elf bard at level 7.
>
> I subscribed to this mailing list a few days ago and so far have just
> seen postings that talk about the higher levels. I've also
> noticed that
> many of the posts sound unsatisfied with the bard character.
>
> My questions:
>
> At level 7, what should I be concentrating on now? What
> items should I
> be pursuing in the near future?
>
> If you had it to over again, would you even pursue the bard
> route? What
> makes the bard fun?
>
>
>
> Jerrilia - Bard of the 7th song. (Luclin)
>
>
>
> Never criticize another man until you've
> walked a mile in his shoes. That way,
> when he finds out what you said about
> him, you're a mile away, and he's barefoot.
>
